Heinrich Harrer was an Austrian mountaineer, sportsman, geographer, and 
author. He is best known for being on the four-man climbing team that made the 
first ascent of the North Face of the Eiger in Switzerland, and for his books Seven 
Years in Tibet (1952) and The White Spider (1959).
